title: Vanuatu national rugby league team
text:
The Vanuatu national rugby league team represents <a href="Vanuatu">Vanuatu</a> in international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> matches. The team was founded in 2011 and is administered by the <a href="Vanuatu%20Rugby%20League">Vanuatu Rugby League</a> (VRL).
History.
The Vanuatu national team was founded in 2011 after <a href="Australian">Australian</a> <a href="Dane%20Campbell">Dane Campbell</a> began to promote rugby league in Vanuatu. Campbell was the inaugural head coach of the team. They played their first match in the <a href="Cabramatta%20International%20Nines">Cabramatta International Nines</a> on 4 February 2012. Joe Meninga, nephew of <a href="Mal%20Meninga">Mal Meninga</a>, was selected in Vanuatu's squad for the tournament. The team were undefeated in reaching the final, where they lost to the <a href="Australian%20Aboriginal%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Aboriginal team</a>.
Vanuatu played their first test match against <a href="Greece%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Greece</a> on 20 October 2012, which they lost 14-24. On 20 August 2013, David Simpson was announced as head coach, succeeding the inaugural head coach Dane Campbell.
